Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Maximin 3  (natural AMPs; UCLL1a; toad, amphibians, animals; ZZHa; ZZS)
Sequence Information.Source: Chinese red belly toad,Bombina maxima, Yunnan, China, Asia

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against E. coli ATCC25922 (MIC 0.9 ug/ml), S. aureus ATCC2592 (MIC 3.1 ug/ml), B. pyocyaneus CMCCB10104 (MIC 1.5 ug/ml), B. megatherium (MIC 0.9 ug/ml), B. dysenterium (MIC 0.9 ug/ml), K. pneumoniae (MIC 3.1 ug/ml), and C. albicans ATCC2002 (MIC 15 uM), A.flavus IFFI4015 (ND), and P.uticale IFFI2001 (ND).It also has anti-HIV and spermicidal effects.active against cancer cells C8166, Molt-4, BIU-4, and T24 (IC50 11-28 ug/ml).In vitro toxicity: human RBC: HC50 >250 ug/ml, less hemo.lytic.   toxic to cell IC50 11.4 ug/ml, anti-HIV-1 EC50 1.5 ug/ml, cell selectivity index 7.6(Lai R et al., 2012).Structure: 3D structure, determined in 50% TFE by 2D NMR, revealsed a helical region covering reisdues 1-22 and a disordered structure at the C-terminus (Benetti et al., 2019).You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB.Updated 2/2012; 12/2015; 2/2019; 2/2020; 11/2024 GW.
Literature Information.Author: Lai R, Zheng Y-T, Shen J-H, Liu GJ, Liu H, Lee W-H, Tang S-Z., Zhang Y.2002.
Literature Information.Title: Antimicrobial peptides from skin secretions of Chinese red belly toad Bombina maxima.
